ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Computer choice...
ygData.msgSnippet: $50 a month? Wow, you have it easy. $50 a month is how much they charge for regular 56K connection where I live. (don t worry, we get a special military
ygData.messageBody:
$50 a month? Wow, you have it easy. $50 a month is how much they charge for
regular 56K connection where I live. (don't worry, we get a special military
discount so it's not quite that much). DSL costs well over $100. Probably
over $200 just to set it up. Well, that's here anyways.
luv,
-Su

> I am running on an Emachine. Choose it because it was effectively
> free, after rebates. My wife likes AOL, and the Compuserve deal was
> good for us. Compuserve IS AOL, in every practical way.
>
> Added memory and a NVidia card with 32 meg. EQ runs alright. Now that
> I am learning more about game machines, I am planning on an Alien for
> my next computer. However, I think that this one will work well
> enough for a year or two. I am sure I will know just when the change
> over must take place. Somewhere where frustration vs available money
> cross each other on the performance chart.
>
> The Emachine needs to be rebooted whenever the game has been played,
> but while in the game I have no performance problems that seem
> excessive or unreasonable for a mid-level system. Compuserve is not
> great, but adequate. I would love DSL, but it is still $50 a month in
> my location.
>
> Barto of Rivervale
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>

>
